s mellitus (GDM) is characterized by 
glucose intolerance that arises during pregnancy. Effective 
dietary management is essential for controlling blood 
glucose levels and minimizing complications for both 
mother and baby. A diet rich in w hole grains, fibre, and 
healthy fats, while low in refined sugars and simple 
carbohydrates, is recommended for managing GDM.10 
The use of a low-glycaemic index diet has been shown to 
improve glycaemic control and reduce the need for insulin 
therapy.11 R
